conclusion: Determine temperature of gas in state C using given information and behavior of ideal gas.
Graph shows pressure (p) versus volume (V) for an ideal gas with vertical and horizontal axes representing pressure and volume.
Segment BC represents a hyperbola with asymptotes.
Gas changes from state A to state C; temperature at state A is 300K.
Segment BC indicates gas expands and contracts with constant pressure.
Gas starts at state A with pressure 4 atm and volume 10 L.
Gas expands to state B with pressure 2 atm and volume 20 L.
Gas contracts to state C with pressure 2 atm and volume 40 L.
Temperature at state B is inferred to be higher than state A due to expansion.
Temperature at state C is same as state B as gas contracts back to state C.
Temperature of gas in state C is same as temperature at state B, which is 300K.
